alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 7:25AM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Northwest winds will gust around 45 to 55 mph, especially this afternoon into tonight. * WHERE...Locations along and west of the Allegheny Front in Maryland and West Virginia as well as western Highland County in Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Sunday. Snow will be heaviest through 9 AM this morning. Snow will become lighter late this morning into early this afternoon. However, another round of snow showers and snow squalls are expected from mid-afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow may reduce visibility below one-quarter mile at times. Near blizzard conditions are possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
